    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "source": [
        "#Import and Merge Dataframes\n",
        "from traitlets.traitlets import Int\n",
        "import pandas as pd\n",
        "import numpy as nm\n",
        "GDP = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/economic/GDP/gdp_current_dollars.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "UI = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/economic/UI/ar203_output.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "Cons = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/economic/consumption/consumption.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "dCons = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/economic/consumption_durable_goods/consumption_durable_goods.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "ndCons = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/economic/consumption_nondurable_goods/consumption_nondurable_goods.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "serCons = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/economic/consumption_services/consumption_services.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "tgCons = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/economic/consumption_total_goods/consumption_total_goods.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "Employ1 = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/economic/employment/CE16OV_output.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "Employ2 = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/economic/employment/PAYEMS_output.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "CPIu = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/economic/inflation/CPIAUCSL_output.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "corePCE = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/economic/inflation/PCEPILFE_output.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "PCE = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/economic/inflation/PCEPI_output.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "Int = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/economic/interest_rates/rates_output.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "Assets = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/economic/investment/K1TTOTL1ES000_output.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "RPFI = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/economic/investment/RPFI_output.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "Prod = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/economic/productivity/labor-productivity-by-state-and-region_output.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "Unemp = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/economic/unemployment/ststdsadata_output.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "ARP = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/intervention/american_rescue_plan/fiscalrecoveryfunds-statefunding1-CSV_output.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "CARES = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/intervention/cares/cares_state_allocation_output.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "PPP = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/intervention/ppp/PPP_states_and_territories_output.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "CDCcasesdeaths = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/pandemic/cases/CDC_state_cases_and_deaths_output.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "JHUcases = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/pandemic/cases/JHU_time_series_cases_output.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "moredeaths = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/pandemic/deaths/time_series_covid19_deaths_US_output_FIXED - time_series_covid19_deaths_US_output.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "Vax1 = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/pandemic/vaccinations/19_Vaccinations_in_the_United_States_Jurisdiction_output_output.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "Vax2 = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/pandemic/vaccinations/time_series_covid19_vaccine_us_output.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "Distance = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/state_mandates/UWashington/USstatesCov19distancingpolicyBETA_complete_output.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "Mask = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/state_mandates/mask_mandates/U.S._State_and_Territorial_Public_Mask_Mandates_From_April_8__2020_through_August_15__2021_by_State_by_Day_output.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "CPI1 = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/economic/inflation/pcpiMvMd.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "Fedfunds = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/economic/interest_rates/FEDFUNDS_output.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "sah = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/state_mandates/shelter_in_place/U.S._State_and_Territorial_Stay-At-Home_Orders__March_15__2020___August_15__2021_by_County_by_Day_output.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "cdcsurv = pd.read_csv('/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/pandemic/cases/CDC_Case_Surveillance.csv', index_col=False)\n",
        "#print(cdcsurv.loc[(cdcsurv['State'] == 'AK') & (cdcsurv['Year'] == 2020)])"
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "id": "wjBN1WWbI_u3"
      },
      "execution_count": null,
      "outputs": []
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "source": [
        "df = GDP.merge(UI,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period']).merge(Cons,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period']).merge(dCons,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period'])\\\n",
        ".merge(ndCons,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period']).merge(serCons,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period']).merge(tgCons,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period']).merge(Employ1,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period'])\\\n",
        ".merge(Employ2,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period']).merge(CPIu,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period']).merge(corePCE,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period']).merge(PCE,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period'])\\\n",
        ".merge(Int,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period']).merge(Assets,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period']).merge(RPFI,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period']).merge(Prod,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period'])\\\n",
        ".merge(Unemp,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period']).merge(CPI1,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period']).merge(moredeaths,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period'], how='left')\\\n",
        ".merge(CDCcasesdeaths,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period'], how='left').merge(JHUcases,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period'], how='left').merge(Vax1,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period'], how='left')\\\n",
        ".merge(Vax2,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period'], how='left').merge(Distance,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period'], how='left').merge(Mask,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period'], how='left')\\\n",
        ".merge(ARP,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period'], how='left').merge(PPP,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period'], how='left').merge(CARES,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period'], how='left')\\\n",
        ".merge(Fedfunds,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period']).merge(sah,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period']).merge(cdcsurv,on=['State', 'Year', 'Period'], how='left')\n",
        "\n"
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "id": "pgvFVG7q6QKd"
      },
      "execution_count": null,
      "outputs": []
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "source": [
        "df = df.fillna(0)"
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "id": "5JL9cMYLB_0p"
      },
      "execution_count": null,
      "outputs": []

    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "source": [
        "#Adjusting for inflation\n",
        "print(df[['Demand_1']])\n",
        "print(df[['Monetary_3']])\n",
        "df['Demand_1'] = df['Demand_1'].div(df['Monetary_3']/100)\n",
        "df['Demand_2'] = df['Demand_2'].div(df['Monetary_3']/100)\n",
        "df['Demand_3'] = df['Demand_3'].div(df['Monetary_3']/100)\n",
        "df['Demand_4'] = df['Demand_4'].div(df['Monetary_3']/100)\n",
        "df['Demand_5'] = df['Demand_5'].div(df['Monetary_3']/100)\n",
        "df['Supply_1'] = df['Supply_1'].div(df['Monetary_3']/100)\n",
        "df['Supply_6'] = df['Supply_6'].div(df['Monetary_3']/100)\n",
        "\n",
        "print(df[['Demand_1']])\n",
        "\n",
        "realValues = df.head(10)\n",
        "\n",

            "9  174.754629\n"

      ]
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "source": [
        "government_fund_dist_unif = {0:1/6,1:1/6,2:1/6,3:1/6,4:1/6,5:1/6}\n",
        "#t = time\n",
        "#a = value\n",
        "#r = (1/a)^(1/t)\n",
        "#government_fund_dist_exp = {0:a(1 – r)t,1:1/6,2:1/6,3:1/6,4:1/6,5:1/6}\n",
        "print(government_fund_dist_unif)"
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "colab": {
          "base_uri": "https://localhost:8080/"
        },
        "id": "ZyLw8oCjFSDF",
        "outputId": "a4f7c927-75f2-4c45-b50e-578bf9e9d4de"
      },
      "execution_count": null,
      "outputs": [
        {
          "output_type": "stream",
          "name": "stdout",
          "text": [
            "{0: 0.16666666666666666, 1: 0.16666666666666666, 2: 0.16666666666666666, 3: 0.16666666666666666, 4: 0.16666666666666666, 5: 0.16666666666666666}\n"
          ]
        }
      ]
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "source": [
        "for i in range(0, len(df)):\n",
        "    if df.loc[i, 'Pandemic_Response_13'] > 0:\n",
        "      for n in range(0, len(government_fund_dist_unif)):\n",
        "          df.loc[i+n, 'Pandemic_Response_13'] = df.loc[i, 'Pandemic_Response_13'] * government_fund_dist_unif[n]\n",
        "      df.loc[i, 'Pandemic_Response_13'] = df.loc[i, 'Pandemic_Response_13'] * government_fund_dist_unif[0]\n",
        "      break\n",
        "\n",
        "for i in range(0, len(df)):\n",
        "    if df.loc[i, 'Pandemic_Response_14'] > 0:\n",
        "      for n in range(0, len(government_fund_dist_unif)):\n",
        "        df.loc[i+n, 'Pandemic_Response_14'] = df.loc[i, 'Pandemic_Response_14'] * government_fund_dist_unif[n]\n",
        "      df.loc[i, 'Pandemic_Response_14'] = df.loc[i, 'Pandemic_Response_14'] * government_fund_dist_unif[0]\n",
        "      break\n",
        "\n",
        "for i in range(0, len(df)):\n",
        "    if df.loc[i, 'Pandemic_Response_15'] > 0:\n",
        "      for n in range(0, len(government_fund_dist_unif)):\n",
        "        df.loc[i+n, 'Pandemic_Response_15'] = df.loc[i, 'Pandemic_Response_15'] * government_fund_dist_unif[n]\n",
        "      df.loc[i, 'Pandemic_Response_15'] = df.loc[i, 'Pandemic_Response_15'] * government_fund_dist_unif[0]\n",
        "      break"
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "id": "X8uwZHeuSI8n"
      },
      "execution_count": null,
      "outputs": []
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "source": [
        "df['Month'] = pd.to_numeric(df['Period'].apply(lambda x: x[1:]))\n",
        "df['Day'] = 1\n",
        "df['Time'] = pd.to_datetime(dict(year=df['Year'], month=df['Month'], day=df['Day']))\n",
        "df = df.drop(columns=['Period', 'Month', 'Year', 'Day'])"
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "id": "Fweqyx3_hc0M"
      },
      "execution_count": null,
      "outputs": []
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "source": [
        "%pip install fastparquet"
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "colab": {
          "base_uri": "https://localhost:8080/"
        },
        "id": "AlCgiGaRWG_z",
        "outputId": "ea6e7d16-7c1c-4c7e-ebec-474e217d61fe"
      },

    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "source": [
        "dfwide = df.loc[df['State'] == 'NY']\n",
        "dfwide = dfwide[:-12]\n",
        "#This is where we slice it to be a single state. The trunctation will be removed when data is updated in OCT\n",
        "\n",
        "\n"
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "id": "8zp90jjRFUg5"
      },
      "execution_count": null,
      "outputs": []
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "markdown",
      "source": [
        "Here are the states:  AK AL AR AZ CA CO CT DE FL GA HI IA ID IL IN KS KY LA MA MD ME MI MN MO MS MT NC ND NE NH NJ NM NV NY OH OK OR PA RI SC SD TN TX UT VA VT WA WI WV WY"
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "id": "gzqycHUch_Vc"
      }
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "source": [
        "#Pivot the table\n",
        "dfwide = dfwide.pivot(index='Time', columns='State')\n"
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "id": "c7is1X9Abfo4"
      },
      "execution_count": null,
      "outputs": []
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "source": [
        "def is_constant(column):\n",
        "    return all(column == column.iloc[0])\n",
        "\n",
        "# Check each column for constancy\n",
        "constant_columns = [col for col in dfwide.columns if is_constant(dfwide[col])]\n",
        "\n",
        "# Print the constant columns\n",
        "print(\"Constant columns:\", constant_columns)\n",
        "#Drop the constant columns\n",
        "dfwide = dfwide.drop(columns=constant_columns)\n",
        "dfwide = dfwide.fillna(0)"
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "colab": {
          "base_uri": "https://localhost:8080/"
        },
        "id": "RdaxDoyocQcD",
        "outputId": "e5b44181-a78b-4ae3-ba9e-59e761a859d0"
      },
      "execution_count": null,
      "outputs": [
        {
          "output_type": "stream",
          "name": "stdout",
          "text": [
            "Constant columns: [('Pandemic_Response_6', 'NY'), ('Pandemic_Response_9', 'NY'), ('Pandemic_Response_8', 'NY')]\n"
          ]
        }
      ]
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "source": [
        "#Render all series normalized and stationary. This will scale them for the post-DFM Synthetic Control Model.\n",
        "from sklearn.preprocessing import MinMaxScaler\n",
        "from statsmodels.tsa.stattools import adfuller\n",
        "scaler = MinMaxScaler()\n",
        "normalized_df = pd.DataFrame(scaler.fit_transform(dfwide), columns=dfwide.columns)*100\n",
        "stationary_df = normalized_df.diff()\n",
        "stationary_df = stationary_df.fillna(0)\n",
        "\n",
        "non_stationary_columns = []\n",
        "for column in stationary_df.columns:\n",
        "  result = adfuller(stationary_df[column])\n",
        "  p_value = result[1]\n",
        "  if p_value > 0.25:\n",
        "        non_stationary_columns.append(column)\n",
        "\n",
        "\n",
        "print(\"Columns that fail the ADF test (non-stationary):\", non_stationary_columns)"
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "colab": {
          "base_uri": "https://localhost:8080/"
        },
        "id": "BkacGks9LdaZ",
        "outputId": "4d4aa625-f865-4733-bf65-96dde1f3f725"
      },
      "execution_count": null,
      "outputs": [
        {
          "output_type": "stream",
          "name": "stdout",
          "text": [
            "Columns that fail the ADF test (non-stationary): [('Demand_3', 'NY'), ('Monetary_4', 'NY'), ('Supply_7', 'NY'), ('Pandemic_3', 'NY'), ('Pandemic_4', 'NY'), ('Pandemic_1', 'NY')]\n"
          ]
        }
      ]
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "source": [
        "# to see csv currently in tabular format\n",
        "#stationary_df.to_csv('stationary.csv', encoding='utf-8', index=False)"
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "id": "tApZfbaoiDTe"
      },
      "execution_count": null,
      "outputs": []
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "source": [
        "#define dictionary, need to call the state being currently used\n",
        "factors = {}\n",
        "for State in [ 'NY']:\n",
        "  for n in range(1,5):\n",
        "    PH = 'Supply_' + str(n) + '_' + str(State)\n",
        "    factors[PH] = 'Global', 'Supply'\n",
        "  for n in range(5,8):\n",
        "    PH = 'Supply_' + str(n)+ '_' + str(State)\n",
        "    factors[PH] = 'Global', 'Uncat'\n",
        "  for n in range(1,6):\n",
        "    PH = 'Demand_' + str(n)+ '_' + str(State)\n",
        "    factors[PH] = 'Global', 'Demand'\n",
        "  for n in range(6,8):\n",
        "    PH = 'Demand_' + str(n)+ '_' + str(State)\n",
        "    factors[PH] = 'Global', 'Uncat'\n",
        "  for n in range(1,13):\n",
        "    PH = 'Pandemic_' + str(n)+ '_' + str(State)\n",
        "    factors[PH] = 'Global', 'Pandemic'\n",
        "  for n in range(1,16):\n",
        "    PH = 'Pandemic_Response_' + str(n)+ '_' + str(State)\n",
        "    factors[PH] = 'Global', 'Response'\n",
        "  for n in range(1,5):\n",
        "    PH = 'Monetary_' + str(n)+ '_' + str(State)\n",
        "    factors[PH] = 'Global', 'Inflation'\n",
        "  for n in range(5,12):\n",
        "    PH = 'Monetary_' + str(n)+ '_' + str(State)\n",
        "    factors[PH] = 'Global', 'Uncat'\n",
        "  PH = 'proportion_vax2' + '_' + str(State)\n",
        "  factors[PH] = 'Global', 'Pandemic'\n",
        "  PH = 'Proportion' + '_' + str(State)\n",
        "  factors[PH] = 'Global', 'Pandemic'\n",
        "\n",
        "print(factors)"
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "id": "9qy63-BzmEBr",

      "outputs": [

'Monetary_10_NY': ('Global', 'Uncat'), 'Monetary_11_NY': ('Global', 'Uncat'), 'proportion_vax2_NY': ('Global', 'Pandemic'), 'Proportion_NY': ('Global', 'Pandemic')}\n"
          ]
        }
      ]
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "source": [
        "def flatten_multiindex_columns(df):\n",
        "    cols = df.columns.to_flat_index()\n",
        "    new_cols = []\n",
        "    for i, col in enumerate(cols):\n",
        "        new_col = '_'.join(map(str, col))\n",
        "        new_cols.append(new_col)\n",
        "    new_df = pd.DataFrame(df.values, columns=new_cols)\n",
        "    return new_df\n",
        "\n",
        "flattened_df = flatten_multiindex_columns(stationary_df)"
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "id": "oGEvDdPwXudy"
      },
      "execution_count": null,
      "outputs": []
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "source": [
        "df_filled = flattened_df.fillna(0)\n",
        "#print(df_filled)\n",
        "#print(factors)"
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "id": "Q6azEuslAuhb"
      },
      "execution_count": null,
      "outputs": []
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "source": [
        "import statsmodels.api as sm\n",
        "factor_multiplicities = {'Global': 2}\n",
        "model = sm.tsa.DynamicFactorMQ(df_filled, factors=factors, factor_multiplicities=factor_multiplicities)\n"
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "id": "fS3Obp7KOEgY"
      },
      "execution_count": null,
      "outputs": []
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "source": [
        "model.summary()"
      ],

              "</tr>\n",

 &       -0.20       &         .         &       .        &        .        &         .          &        .        &              -0.43               &      0.17           },
          "metadata": {},
          "execution_count": 25
        }
      ]
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "source": [
        "%pip install fastparquet\n",
        "df.to_parquet('dfwide.parquet.gzip', compression='gzip')\n",
        "cp -r 'dfwide.parquet.gzip' '/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/'\n",
        "import json\n",
        "with open(\"/content/drive/Shareddrives/EB-198 Research/Data/output/factors.json\", \"w\") as outfile:\n",
        "    json.dump(factors, outfile)"
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "id": "hTNaWCC6q9Gt"
      },
      "execution_count": null,
      "outputs": []
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "markdown",
      "source": [
        "The DFM will assign observables to the latent variables to be estimated by forcing the values of the weighting matrix to be zero when a core variable interacts with a core observation from another assignment. There are 5 core classes, Supply, Demand, Pandemic, Pandemic Response and Monetary.\n",
        "\n",
        "Then have 2 non core that everything is determined by.\n",
        "\n",
        "https://www.statsmodels.org/dev/generated/statsmodels.tsa.statespace.dynamic_factor_mq.DynamicFactorMQ.html\n",
        "\n",
